edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Class TaskProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.tracker.TaskProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class TaskProperties
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class TaskProperties encapsulates the properties of a Task. The following properties may be specified:
    • threads — The number of threads executing parallel loops in the task.
    • schedule — The schedule for parallel loops in the task.
    • chunk — The chunk size for parallel loops in the task.
    • nodeName — The name of the node on which to run the task.
    • cores — The number of CPU cores needed to run the task.
    • gpus — The number of GPU accelerators needed to run the task.

    Class TaskProperties provides a chaining capability. If a certain setting in a task properties object is defaulted, and the task properties object has a chained task properties object, the setting's value will be that of the chained task properties object. If the setting is defaulted in every chained task properties object, the setting's value will be a predefined default value. When a task properties object is serialized by the writeOut() method, the chained task properties objects if any are not serialized; only the ultimate setting values are serialized.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL_CORES
      Indicates that the task requires all the cores on the node.
      static int ALL_GPUS
      Indicates that the task requires all the GPU accelerators on the node.

      Indicates that the task can run on any node of the cluster.

      Indicates that the schedule property is defaulted.

      Indicates that the threads property is defaulted.
      static int STANDARD_CHUNK
      Indicates to use the standard chunk size for the schedule property.
      static int THREADS_EQUALS_CORES
      Indicates that a parallel for loop will be executed by as many threads as there are cores on the machine.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskProperties

        public TaskProperties()
        Construct a new task properties object. All settings are defaulted.

      • TaskProperties

        public TaskProperties(int threads,
              Schedule schedule,
              int chunk,
              String nodeName,
              int cores,
              int gpus)
        Construct a new task properties object with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        threads - Number of threads for a parallel for loop, THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, or DEFAULT_THREADS.
        schedule - Schedule for a parallel for loop, or DEFAULT_SCHEDULE.
        chunk - Chunk size for a parallel for loop, STANDARD_CHUNK, or DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        nodeName - Node name on which the task must execute, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        cores - Number of CPU cores the task requires, ALL_CORES, or DEFAULT_CORES.
        gpus - Number of GPU accelerators the task requires, ALL_GPUS, or DEFAULT_GPUS.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if threads, chunk, cores, or gpus is illegal.

      • TaskProperties

        public TaskProperties(TaskProperties props)
        Construct a new task properties object that is a copy of the given task properties object. The chained task properties objects of props, if any, are not copied; only the ultimate property values are copied.
        Parameters:
        props - Task properties.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if props is null.

      • threads

        public TaskProperties threads(int threads)
        Set the threads property. The threads property specifies the number of threads that will execute a parallel for loop.
        Parameters:
        threads - Number of threads (≥ 1), THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, or DEFAULT_THREADS.
        Returns:
        This task properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if threads is illegal.
        See Also:
        threads(), actualThreads()

      • threads

        public int threads()
        Get the threads property. The threads property specifies the number of threads that will execute a parallel for loop. If the threads property is defaulted or is THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, and the cores property is set to a specific number of cores (≥ 1), then the cores property setting is returned. Otherwise, if the threads property is defaulted, THREADS_EQUALS_CORES is returned, indicating that a parallel for loop will be executed by as many threads as there are cores on the machine. Otherwise, the threads property setting is returned.

        Note: The threads() method returns the threads property setting, which may be THREADS_EQUALS_CORES. For the actual number of threads, see the actualThreads() method.

        Returns:
        Number of threads (≥ 1), or THREADS_EQUALS_CORES.
        See Also:
        threads(int), actualThreads()

      • actualThreads

        public int actualThreads()
        Get the number of threads that will execute a parallel for loop.

        Note: If the threads property is THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, the actualThreads() method returns the actual number of threads that will execute a parallel for loop, namely the number of cores on the machine. For the threads property setting, see the threads() method.

        Returns:
        Number of threads (≥ 1).
        See Also:
        threads(int), threads()

      • schedule

        public TaskProperties schedule(Schedule schedule)
        Set the schedule property. The schedule property, along with the chunk property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        schedule - Parallel for loop schedule.
        Returns:
        This task properties object.
        See Also:
        schedule(), chunk(int), chunk()

      • schedule

        public Schedule schedule()
        Get the schedule property. The schedule property, along with the chunk property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. If the schedule property is defaulted, a fixed schedule is returned.
        Returns:
        Parallel for loop schedule.
        See Also:
        schedule(Schedule), chunk(int), chunk()

      • chunk

        public TaskProperties chunk(int chunk)
        Set the chunk property. The chunk property, along with the schedule property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        chunk - Chunk size (≥ 1), STANDARD_CHUNK, or DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        Returns:
        This task properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if chunk is illegal.
        See Also:
        schedule(Schedule), schedule(), chunk()

      • chunk

        public int chunk()
        Get the chunk property. The chunk property, along with the schedule property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. If the chunk property is defaulted, STANDARD_CHUNK is returned, indicating the standard chunk size for the schedule property; see enum Schedule for further information.
        Returns:
        Chunk size (≥ 1), or STANDARD_CHUNK.
        See Also:
        schedule(Schedule), schedule(), chunk(int)

      • nodeName

        public TaskProperties nodeName(String nodeName)
        Set the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which the task must run.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Node name, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        Returns:
        This task properties object.
        See Also:
        nodeName()

      • nodeName

        public String nodeName()
        Get the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which the task must run. If the nodeName property is defaulted, ANY_NODE_NAME is returned, indicating that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
        Returns:
        Node name, or ANY_NODE_NAME.
        See Also:
        nodeName(String)

      • cores

        public int cores()
        Get the cores property. The cores property specifies the number of CPU cores the task requires. If the cores property is defaulted, ALL_CORES is returned, indicating that the task requires all the cores on the node.
        Returns:
        Number of cores (≥ 1), or ALL_CORES.
        See Also:
        cores(int)

      • gpus

        public TaskProperties gpus(int gpus)

        Returns:
        This task properties object.
        Throws:

        See Also:
        gpus()

      • gpus

        public int gpus()
        Get the gpus property. The gpus property specifies the number of GPU accelerators the task requires. If the gpus property is defaulted, 0 is returned, indicating that the task requires no GPU accelerators.
        Returns:
        Number of GPUs (≥ 0).
        See Also:
        gpus(int)
